Package com.vercator

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
com.vercator.Matrix
public class Matrix extends Object
Simplified matrix class for handling point cloud transformations

  • Constructor Details

    • Matrix

      public Matrix​(int rows, int cols, double value)
      Create a matrix of shape (rows, columns) and initializes the elements to the specified value. - Negative rows and columns raise the NegativeArraySizeException. - Zero rows or columns allow for empty matrix.
      Parameters:
      rows - should be greater than zero
      cols - should be greater than zero
      value - initial value

    • Matrix

      public Matrix​(int rows, int cols)
      Create a matrix of shape (rows, columns) and initializes the elements to 0. - Negative rows and columns raise the NegativeArraySizeException. - Zero rows or columns allow for empty matrix.
      Parameters:
      rows - should be greater than zero
      cols - should be greater than zero

    • Matrix

      public Matrix​(double[][] values)
      Create a matrix filled with values
      Parameters:
      values - are the matrix elements

    • Matrix

      public Matrix​(List<String> stringArray)
      Import matrix from a list of string format
      Parameters:
      stringArray - is a list of rows containing numbers in string format

  • Method Details

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Number of matrix rows
      Returns:
      the size of first dimension

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Number of matrix columns
      Returns:
      the size of second dimension

    • getRowVector

      public double[] getRowVector​(int row)
      Row-vector
      Parameters:
      row - is the row index ranging from zero to getRows()
      Returns:
      an array of doubles with the elements in the specified row

    • multiply

      public Matrix multiply​(Matrix B)
      Matrix-Matrix product A.B=C Multiply the matrix A (this) by B. A (this) is a n by k matrix
      Parameters:
      B - is a k by m matrix
      Returns:
      the resulting n by m matrix C

    • subtract

      public Matrix subtract​(Matrix B)
      Subtract the values of B from this matrix row-wise. Columns must agree!
      Parameters:
      B - is a row-vector with same number of columns as this matrix
      Returns:
      a new matrix subtracted B values from each row

    • add

      public Matrix add​(Matrix B)
      Add the values of B to this matrix row-wise. Columns must agree!
      Parameters:
      B - is a row-vector with same number of columns as this matrix
      Returns:
      a new matrix added by B values in each row

    • meanOfRowValues

      public Matrix meanOfRowValues()
      Compute the mean row-wise preserving columns
      Returns:
      a row-vector with the mean of the original rows for each column

    • transpose

      public Matrix transpose()
      Transpose Operation
      Returns:
      a matrix with transposed rows and columns

    • addRow

      public Matrix addRow​(double value)
      Concatenate row at the end
      Parameters:
      value - used to fill the new row elements
      Returns:
      a matrix with an additional row filled with the specified value

    • popRow

      public Matrix popRow()
      Remove row at the end
      Returns:
      a matrix without the original last row

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Format matrix content row-wise and to prevent java from creating its own version of toString.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a formatted string filled with matrix elements
